subject: Re: Reminder: Order #SSN4084, how did it go?
description_text:
The clutch reaktor died after 1 hour use. It got stuck on and after i took
out the power both the reactor and the clutch input on the hub are dead.
And now the break reactor is starting to get stuck on

lør. 20. des. 2025, 13:19 skrev SIMSONN <no-reply@loox.io>:

> Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes
> a few

conversations.body_text: Hi Finn Von Schmedling,  Please provide your pedal order number, and then update the firmware again. The manual firmware update procedures are as follows for your reference, and please also refer to the grounding method to ensure proper device operation.      Launch the latest version of SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2.   On the “Plus X” control unit, press and hold the “Upgrade” button. While holding the button, unplug the USB cable from the PC and then plug it back in. The software should detect the device entering “SIMSONN Flasher update mode”. In the software go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update. In the file selector choose: pedals‑firmware → pedals‑plusx.sfu. Click “Start Update” and wait until the firmware is completely written. During this process do not disconnect the USB or close the application. Once the update is finished (you’ll get a success prompt or the unit will reboot), unplug and re‑plug the USB then test the pedal device to confirm everything works correctly.      ProX / ProX Ultra Pedal Firmware Update Procedure:    Press and hold the Upgrade button on the control box;    Reconnect the USB cable;    The software will indicate that the device has entered “Simsonn Flasher mode”;    In the software, go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-proxultra.sfu (If it’s a ProX pedal, select pedals-prox.sfu)    Start the firmware update, and once it is complete, release the Upgrade button;    Finally, retest and calibrate the pedals.    If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding           ​

Now i tried everything above. The grounding is solid. The Vam is stil dead.

man. 22. des. 2025, 13:48 skrev service@simsonn.com

VID_20251223_155922.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DrBbe0YTmAuNemaIiJwkodloDybF8a4W/view?usp=drivesdk>


tir. 23. des. 2025, 15:57 skrev Finn Von Schmedling <fschmedling@gmail.com>:

> Now i tried everything above. The grounding is solid. The Vam is stil
> dead.
>
> man. 22. des. 2025, 13:48 skrev service@simsonn.com
Hi Finn Von Schmedling,  Please install the ToDesk remote tool (no registration required) and provide your ID and temporary access code. I will assist you remotely to check and resolve the issue.

So you need acsess to my computer? The wam is dead in all inputs how can
you fix this remotely?

ons. 24. des. 2025, 07:06 skrev service@simsonn.com

Also now my clutch pedal stoped working. So the hub is damaged. So need new
hardware.

lør. 3. jan. 2026, 21:18 skrev Finn Von Schmedling <fschmedling@gmail.com>:

> So you need acsess to my computer? The wam is dead in all inputs how can
> you fix this remotely?
>
> ons. 24. des. 2025, 07:06 skrev service@simsonn.com

Hi Finn Von Schmedling,  Please try swapping the clutch and throttle connectors to test whether the issue is with the pedal itself or the connection/control box. If any component is confirmed to be faulty, we can provide replacement spare parts for the damaged component.

Hey. Thanks for the reply.

Now ive tried all 3 pedals and all 3 reactors in all 3 of the ports on the
hub. Port 3 is dead, so is the cluch pedal and reactor.



ons. 7. jan. 2026, 16:31 skrev service@simsonn.com
Hi Finn Von Schmedling,  I will send you a replacement ProX Ultra controller box and a ProX Ultra clutch sensor. Could you please confirm if this is correct?

Confirm. And a cluch vam reactor.

søn. 11. jan. 2026, 02:32 skrev service@simsonn.com

Hi Finn Von Schmedling,     You can slightly loosen the four screws on the cover on the “S” side of the VAM Pro, then remove the motor and inspect it. Please check whether the washer inside has shifted. You can reposition it properly, or take a photo and send it to me for confirmation. After that, reinstall the motor — in many cases, this will restore normal operation.  If the issue is still not resolved after this, we will send you a replacement VAM Pro.

Im away from home fir a while, so if you can just send a new hub and cluch
now it would be great. So then ill see if the reactir starts working or not.


søn. 11. jan. 2026, 04:49 skrev service@simsonn.com

So what happens?

tir. 13. jan. 2026, 06:49 skrev Finn Von Schmedling <fschmedling@gmail.com>:

> Im away from home fir a while, so if you can just send a new hub and cluch
> now it would be great. So then ill see if the reactir starts working or not.
>
>

Now after a week without use, all my pedals stopped working. And the
software cant find them. Im really not happy whit this product
